newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Kohl advises Yeltsin not to overdo things - Kremlin.
newsitem.headline: Kohl advises Yeltsin not to overdo things - Kremlin.

text.p: President Boris Yeltsin spoke to German Chancellor Helmut Kohl on the telephone on Tuesday and Kohl advised the Russian leader not to overdo things after his heart operation, a Kremlin spokesman said.

Presidential press spokesman Sergei Yastrzhembsky said the two leaders spoke for seven minutes. Kohl congratulated Yeltsin on his speedy recovery after last week's surgery and repeated an invitation that the Russian president convalesce in Germany.

It was Yeltsin's first telephone conversation with a foreign leader since his quintuple bypass operation. The two men regard each other as friends and Kohl visited Moscow just before the operation, passing on his best wishes to Yeltsin.
